1.verse: Chapter 1 -Salutation -Address. -Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, whose promise of life is fulfilled in Christ Jesus,

2.verse: to Timothy, my beloved child: grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.verse: Thanksgiving and Prayer. -I am grateful to God—whom I worship with a clean conscience as did my ancestors—when I remember you constantly in my prayers night and day.

4.verse: As I recall your tears, I long to see you again so that my joy may be complete.

5.verse: I also remember your sincere faith, a faith that first came to life in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice, and that I am convinced also dwells in you.

6.verse: The Endurance of a Man of God -Revive the Gift of God. -For this reason, I remind you to stir up the gift of God that is within you through the laying on of my hands.

7.verse: For God did not give us a spirit of timidity but rather a spirit of power and of love and of wisdom.

8.verse: Therefore, you should never be ashamed of bearing witness to our Lord, nor of me because I am imprisoned for his sake. Rather, you should utilize the strength that comes from God to share in my hardships for the sake of the gospel.

9.verse: God saved us and called us to a life of holiness, not because of our works but according to his own purpose and the grace that has been bestowed upon us in Christ Jesus from all eternity.

10.verse: That grace has now been revealed by the appearance of our Savior Jesus Christ. He has abolished death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel,

11.verse: for which I have been appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher.

12.verse: Guard the Treasure Entrusted to Us. -That is the reason why I am undergoing my present sufferings. However, I am not ashamed, for I know the one in whom I have placed my trust, and I am confident that he is able to guard until that Day what he has entrusted to me.

13.verse: Follow the pattern of sound teaching that you heard from me, with faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.

14.verse: With the help of the Holy Spirit who dwells in us, guard the treasure that has been entrusted to us.

15.verse: Comfort Those in Suffering. -As you are well aware, everyone in Asia has deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.

16.verse: May the Lord be merciful to the household of Onesiphorus, because he has often been a comfort to me in my troubles, and he has never been ashamed of my chains.

17.verse: When he arrived in Rome, he concentrated on searching for me until he found me.

18.verse: May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that Day. He also helped me in many ways at Ephesus, as you are well aware.

1.verse: The Exemplars of a Man of God -Chapter 2 -Accept Your Share of Sufferings. -As for you, my child, take strength from the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

2.verse: And the things you learned from me in the presence of many witnesses you must pass on to trustworthy people who will be capable of teaching others.

3.verse: Together with me, bear your share of sufferings like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

4.verse: A soldier does not become involved in everyday affairs, for his task is to obey his commanding officer.

5.verse: In a similar vein, no athlete can receive the winner’s crown unless he has competed according to the rules.

6.verse: Again, the farmer who does the hard work should have the first claim on the crops.

7.verse: Think about what I am saying, for the Lord will help you to understand it perfectly.

8.verse: Remember That Jesus Christ Is Risen. -Remember the gospel that I preach: Jesus Christ, a descendant of David, was raised from the dead.

9.verse: It is because of this that I have endured great suffering, even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But the word of God cannot be chained.

10.verse: Therefore, I endure everything for the sake of those who are chosen, so that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.

11.verse: This saying can be trusted:If we have died with him,we shall also live with him.

12.verse: If we endure,we shall also reign with him.If we deny him,he will also deny us.

13.verse: If we are unfaithful,he will remain faithful,for he cannot deny himself.

14.verse: A True Servant of the Lord. -Remind people of these things, and warn them before God that they must stop arguing over words. This does no good and only causes harm to those who are listening.

15.verse: Make every effort to present yourself before God as one who is worthy of his approval, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, but who imparts the word of truth without any alteration.

16.verse: Avoid idle and worldly chatter, for those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly,

17.verse: and their teaching will spread like a plague. Included among these are Hymenaeus and Philetus,

18.verse: who have gone astray from the truth. They claim that the resurrection has already taken place, and they damage the faith of some.

19.verse: However, the foundation that God has sealed remains firm, and it bears this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his own,” and “Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.”

20.verse: In every large house, there are utensils not only of gold and silver but also of wood and clay—some for noble purposes and some for ordinary purposes.

21.verse: If someone avoids these things I have mentioned, he will be regarded as a vessel of special value, dedicated and useful for the master of the house, and ready to perform any good work.

22.verse: Turn away from youthful passions and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace, together with those who call on the Lord with a pure heart.

23.verse: Avoid foolish and stupid speculations, for you are well aware that they only result in quarrels.

24.verse: A servant of the Lord should not engage in quarrels but should be kind to everyone. He should be a good teacher and patient,

25.verse: correcting with gentleness those who oppose him. For God may grant them repentance so that they may come to recognize the truth

26.verse: and regain their senses, enabling them to escape the snare of the devil who had held them captive and subjected them to his will.

1.verse: The Tasks of a Man of God -Chapter 3 -Repulse the Onslaughts of False Teachers. -You must realize that there will be great distress in the last days.

2.verse: People will love nothing but themselves and money. They will be boastful, arrogant, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, irreligious,

3.verse: and devoid of natural affection. They will be implacable, slanderous, licentious, brutal, and haters of everything that is good.

4.verse: They will be treacherous, reckless, conceited, and lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God

5.verse: as they maintain the appearance of godliness but deny its power. Avoid persons like that!

6.verse: They are the type who insinuate themselves into households and gain control of the women there who are burdened by their sins and obsessed with their desires,

7.verse: and who are always seeking to be taught but unable to ever arrive at a knowledge of the truth.

8.verse: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these men, with their depraved minds and their deceitful pretense of faith, also oppose the truth.

9.verse: But they will not succeed in their efforts. As was the case with those men, their folly will become obvious to everyone.

10.verse: Remain Faithful in Persecution. -As for you, however, you have followed my teaching, my way of life, my aims, my faith, my patience, my love, my perseverance,

11.verse: my persecutions, my sufferings—the things that I faced in Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra and that I endured. Yet the Lord brought me out safely from all of them.

12.verse: Indeed, persecution will afflict all who want to lead a godly life in Christ Jesus,

13.verse: while wicked people and impostors will grow ever worse, deceiving others and being themselves deceived.

14.verse: But as for you, stand by what you have learned and firmly believed, because you know from whom you have learned it.

15.verse: Gain Wisdom from the Inspired Scriptures. -Also remember that from the time you were a child you have known the sacred Scriptures. From these you can acquire the wisdom that will lead you to salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

16.verse: All Scripture is inspired by God and is useful for teaching, for refutation, for correction, and for training in uprightness,

17.verse: so that the man of God may be proficient and equipped for good work of every kind.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -The Preaching of a Man of God -The Charge To Preach. -In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who is to judge the living and the dead, and by his appearing and his kingdom, I charge you:

2.verse: preach the message; be persistent in doing so, whether in season or out of season; convince, reprove, and encourage, but with great patience and instruction.

3.verse: The Need for Preaching. -For the time is coming when people will not accept sound doctrine, but they will follow their own desires and accumulate teachers who will preach to their itching ears.

4.verse: They will shut their ears to the truth and be captivated by myths.

5.verse: As for you, always be sober. Endure hardships, do the work of preaching the gospel, and carry out your ministry to the fullest extent.

6.verse: The Triumphs of a Man of God -Reward for Fidelity. -As for me, I am already being poured out as a libation, and the time has come for my departure.

7.verse: I have fought the good fight; I have finished the race; I have kept the faith.

8.verse: Now waiting for me is the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will award to me on that Day—and not only to me, but to all those who have eagerly longed for his appearance.

9.verse: Comfort in Trial. -Make every effort to come to me as soon as possible.

10.verse: Because of his love of worldly pursuits, Demas has deserted me and gone off to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus has left for Dalmatia.

11.verse: No one but Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, for he has been helpful to me in my ministry.

12.verse: I have sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

13.verse: When you come, bring along with you the cloak that I left with Carpus in Troas, and also the scrolls, particularly the parchments.

14.verse: Alexander the coppersmith has done me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for his deeds.

15.verse: Be on guard yourself against him, for he has been strongly opposed to our teaching.

16.verse: At the first hearing of my case, no one came to court to support me. Every one of them deserted me. May it not be held against them!

17.verse: But the Lord stood at my side and gave me strength so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it.Thus was I rescued from the lion’s jaws.

18.verse: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory forever and ever. Amen.

19.verse: Conclusion -Final Greetings. -Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

20.verse: Erastus remained in Corinth, while I left Trophimus ill in Miletus.

21.verse: Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus sends greetings to you, as do Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren.

22.verse: Farewell. -The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with all of you.
